sub_title: Senior PRODUCTION GEOLOGIST / GEOMODELLER (M.Sc. Degree in Geology)
summary:
A well-qualified and highly motivated geologist with over 25 years experience in the oil & gas industry. Highly competent in production and operations geology with significant expertise in conducting geological studies. My colleagues recognise me as an excellent team player, eager to share knowledge and learn from others.

Main experience gained worldwide includes but is not limited to expertise in making conceptual and building 3D static reservoir models (Petrel tool/hands-on). As consequent duties were volume estimates, mapping, technical assurances (accredited TA3 & TA2 in Integrated Reservoir Modelling (IRM)), and frequent involvements in the field development planning (FDP), reservoir characterisation studies, stratigraphic and structural analyses, etc.

Additionally, I worked as a consulting Operations and Wellsite geologist (aSME) for over 12 years. As a result, I acquired broad experience in all stages of developing a well, including identifying potential drilling locations and assisting the drilling and WRFM teams with well planning, contract preparation & management, and execution of various geological operations. A significant part of my operations skills come from offshore drilling rigs, where I, as a wellsite geologist, supervised contractor staff, supported drilling operations, analysed rocks & reservoir fluids, etc.

Extensive experience from joint venture (JV) companies: 2½ years at Shell/CMOC in Kazakhstan; 5 years with Shell-SPDC in Nigeria; 4 years as Shell staff, seconded in Kuwait Oil Company (KOC); 3 years with ExxonMobile/RasGas (JV) in Qatar, etc. 

I have experience in clastic and carbonate reservoirs (both conventional & unconventional) with high H2S and CO2 gases (for 11 years with carbonates in Qatar and Kuwait).

profile_positions.description:
Initially deployed in the Project Team as a Senior Production Geologist within Shell-SPDC Development Studies Centre. Successively promoted to Lead Geologist within the newly formed Integrated Reservoir Modelling (IRM) team. 
•	Combines inherent leadership, creativity and analytical skills with state-of-the-art technology to visualise subsurface uncertainties,  overcome current production issues and aid investment decisions relating to discoveries and maturing assets.
•	Coordinates the continuous flow of data from a multidisciplinary subsurface team to build and maintain conceptual and hands-on integrated 3D reservoir models for a portfolio of onshore and shallow water reservoirs in the Niger Delta.
•	Responsibilities for model deliverables such as final facies & properties, cross-sections, various structural & properties maps, in-place STOIIP & GIIP volumes, volumetric and sensitivity analysis (Tornado Plots), and reports;
•	Feeds the results from static models, reservoir characterizations, seismic interpretation and reservoir uncertainty distributions into Feasibility Reports, Field Development Plans and Well Proposals, etc.
•	As a certified Technical Assurer (levels 2 & 3), ensures volumetric estimates and subsurface evaluations are fully compliant with the EP and IRM standards and corporate technical assurance framework.
•	As an associated subject-matter expert in Ops geology, prepares and translates well proposals into optimized operations and drilling parameter evaluations.
•	Coaching and mentoring less experienced production geologists in facies and structural modelling;
Notable Achievements:
•	Developed a new workflow for Structural Uncertainties Modelling, which accelerated IRM output by approximately 40%.
•	Organised and conducted presentations on Sedimentological Applications in Static Modelling, Conceptual Depositional Model for the MiniNta Field and Real-Time Over-Pressure Prediction using Mud-Logging Data.

profile_positions.description:
Worked in the cross-functional team with other geoscientists and engineers and provided geological support for the GTL-Pearl Project. I led the operations geology team toughly involved in drilling HPHT wells with high CO2 and H2S concentrations in one of the world's most prolific gas fields (Khuff reservoir).
Responsible for PEARL GTL static model updates (20+ new wells, new facies, and updated property models) as input into the 2008 expectation reserves model + future use in updating the development plan.
•	I have incorporated new e-log facies into the G2.7 model to define a more detailed facies model to constrain por-perm heterogeneity across the field better and test multiple distribution possibilities;
•	Re-defined leaching corridors to enable inclusions of all wells to contain leaching facies across the North 
Field. Run a few volumetric scenarios (Sw from e-log and Sw/PHIT function) to define the most realistic 
GIIP of complex carbonate reservoirs;
Operations responsibilities for the GTL project are as follows:
•	Leader of operations geology team responsible  for support to 2 offshore drilling rigs
•	Contract holder, preparation, and management for wellsite geologists (4 staff, app. 1.8mil USD)
•	Responsibility for planning 21 gas development wells (Khuff reservoir)
•	Also responsible for planning & geological operations of 2 water-disposal wells (Ras Laffan/onshore)
•	Conducted geo-hazards study for the Pearl project in Qatar,
•	Completed ‘North Field Geological Atlas’ stored at RIJ library
•	Core descriptions of 8 cores taken from Khuff carbonates
